intro: Trifolium gymnocarpon var. lemmonii, commonly known as the Lemmon's clover, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
